title: Big South Fork National River & Recreation Area: Backcountry Permits
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Permits & Reservations     Backcountry Permits                Backcountry Permits           By clicking on this you are agreeing to follow all food storage and camping regulations in the backcountry.Â  Get more information at http://www.nps.gov/biso/planyourvisit/backcountry-hiking-and-camping.htm   BACKCOUNTRY CAMPING PERMITS   Backcountry permits are required for all visitors who will camp in the backcountry for one or more nights. These permits are good for the length of stay but not longer than 14 days. Permit fees are based on group size.  Groups with more than 25 persons must obtain a Special Use Permit. Backcountry Camping Permits may be obtained at one of our visitor centers or online.         1 to 6 person(s) $5.00*    7 to 12 persons  $10.00*    13 to 18 persons  $15.00*    19 to 24 persons  $20.00*      *Holders of the Interagency Senior/Access Passes pay only half the fee.
